meanings.definition: The rate or speed of motion or activity
meanings.sent1: The tempos of the dancers varied throughout the performance.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the tempos of the treadmill to challenge herself.
meanings.sent3: The tempos of the ants marching in a line were surprisingly synchronized.
meanings.sent4: The tempos of life's ups and downs can be unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The tempos of the music set the mood for the entire event.

meanings.definition: A characteristic rate, rhythm, or pattern of work or activity
meanings.sent1: The team worked together seamlessly, each following their own tempos.
meanings.sent2: His writing style has unique tempos that captivate the readers.
meanings.sent3: The tempos of the office seemed to dance to their own tune.
meanings.sent4: In nature, the tempos of the seasons create a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent5: The tempos of the city never seem to slow down.
